definition[0]: a metal frame with bars across it
definition[1]: a pattern of straight lines that cross each other and form squares
example[0]: Its streets were laid out in a grid pattern.
definition[2]: a set of numbered lines printed on a map so that the exact position of any place can be referred to
example[1]: The pilots were just given a grid reference  (=number referring to a point on a map) of the target.
definition[3]: the network of electricity supply wires that connects power stations and provides electricity to buildings in an area
example[2]: the national grid  (=the electricity supply in a country)
definition[4]: a set of starting positions for all the cars in a motor race
